intro: Racosperma victoriae, commonly known as the Victoria's acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and often compound leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or pale green, arranged in dense inflorescences. Racosperma victoriae is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions.
